medium:
Ch'ing-pai ware
Porcelain with pale blue glaze
title: Wine Cup and Stand
text: Ch'ing-pai cup stands with pierced trefoil motifs first appeared in the eleventh century. This type of thinly potted porcelain cup and stand can be seen in Sung dynasty (960-1279) paintings illustrating banquet scenes. Intended for elegant dining, these vessels should be seen in the context of other Ch'ing-pai tableware such as the bowls, ewers, and saucers shown here.
description: robin\'s egg blue glaze; stand has scalloped edge on bottom with perforated repeated design at base; cup has scalloped edge
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
